ygData.subject: RE: Duel Wield Preferences
ygData.msgSnippet: That s because there is some sort of problem or feature that causes an unreasonable number of hits for 1.  The number of hits for 1 damage generally exceeds
ygData.messageBody:
That's because there is some sort of problem or 'feature' that causes an
unreasonable number of hits for 1. The number of hits for 1 damage
generally exceeds the sum of all the other hits for less than average damage
every time I have parsed a file. Whether this is because a hit was totally
absorbed by armor and there is a minimum of 1 damage or some strange coding
I cannot tell. I was totally flabbergasted the first time I laid out my
damages on a graph by number of occurrences per damage value and was sure I
was mistaken, but I redid the test three times and it stayed just as
unbalanced. When was the last time anyone hit for 2 with a weapon with a
damage of 6 or more? The last two logs files I parsed had over 150 hits for
1 each, but not a single hit for 2. That's way bizarre in terms of
statistical likelihood unless there is some other force like a minimum
damage after armor in effect.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: kim@... [mailto:kim@...]
Sent: Wednesday, January 26, 2000 10:16 AM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Duel Wield Preferences


From: <kim@...>

On Tue, 25 Jan 2000, Keith Mann wrote:
> > From: kim@...
> >
> > I woudln't be surprised if they coded it so
> > that the best weapon at a certain str/dex/sta was not the best
> > weapon at a different str/dex/sta.
>
> Interesting idea. Does anyone have any data? I'm especially curious about
> the effects of strength bonuses. If strength "x" gives "y" points of bonus
> damage "z" percent of the time, regardless of weapon, then 2*dmg+1/delay
> becomes (2*dmg+1+(x*z/100))/delay...

Most of the data I've seen on the effect of strength is that
it increases your max damage without changing your average by
a noticable amount. That could be because of too small a
sample size, or because Verant coded it wrong.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
